author.firstname: Generated with the Machining Knowledge Editor

sect1.title: Description
sect1.para: This is just a sample rule on a legacy manufacturing feature. The preferred route is to map legacy features to parametric features and define the manufacturing rules on the parametric features.

simplelist.member: $$ Spot Drilling is generally not required and this Rule assumes an existing center point.
$$ The feature diameter is too large to drill at once..

sect1.title: Description
sect1.para: Drill into the blank material to obtain a centerpoint. The class name for a centerpoint is POCKET_ROUND_TAPERED.

simplelist.member: $$ Slanted surface, must drill after spot facing
$$ This is not a drill point but a tapered hole.
REM Less Worked Feature Attributes. Are Not Applicable since this starts from BLANK.

sect1.title: Description
sect1.para: This Rule uses CAVITY_MILL now. Previously FACE_MILLING_AREA.

simplelist.member: REM allow bigger tool for roughing. This is just an example.
IF is_defined(mwf.Stock_Wall) THEN tool.Diameter < mwf.RADIUS*2*2 ELSE tool.Diameter < mwf.RADIUS*2
REM another upper limit for the tool.
REM Path Settings - Cutting Parameters - Strategy - Cutting
REM Path Settings - Cutting Parameters - Strategy - Finish Passes
REM Path Settings - Cutting Parameters - Strategy - Stock
REM Path Settings - Cutting Parameters - Corners - Path Shape in Corners
REM Path Settings - Cutting Parameters - Connections - Across Voids
$$ Bottom roughness value does not need a finishing operation.
$$ Bottom roughness value cannot be reached with END MILL.
REM Stay away from the wall when finishing the bottom.
REM Path Settings - Cutting Parameters - Connections - Across Voids
$$ Side roughness value does not need a finishing operation.
$$ Side roughness value cannot be reached with END MILL.
REM Stay away from the floor when finishing the wall.

sect1.title: Description
sect1.para:
Feature.SubType = 1 means the feature is machined with tool axis perpendicular to the floor face. The radius between floor face and bottom face is absent and must have value = 0.
Feature.SubType = 2 means the feature is machined with tool axis perpendicular to the floor face. The radius between floor face and bottom face has a value > 0.
This Rule uses CAVITY_MILL because of the bottom radius.

simplelist.member: $$ Feature subtype must be 2 (machined from above, with a bottom radius)
$$ Side Roughness too fine for MILL
$$ Side Roughness too course for MILL
$$ Bottom Roughness too fine for MILL
$$ Bottom Roughness too course for MILL
REM Path Settings - Cutting Parameters - Strategy - Cutting
REM because of cavity mill: oper.Cut_Walls_Only ="off"
REM Path Settings - Cutting Parameters - Strategy - Finish Passes
REM Path Settings - Cutting Parameters - Strategy - Stock
REM because of cavity mill: oper.Wall_Stock

sect1.title: Description

sect1.title: Description
sect1.para: Drill on bottom of a stepped pocket to create a step3pocket

simplelist.member: $$ The third diameter is too large to drill at once.
$$ Diameter Tolerance smaller than lower boundary
$$ Diameter Tolerance larger than upper boundary
$$ Side Roughness too fine for DRILL
$$ Side Roughness too course for DRILL
REM Less Worked Feature Attribute changes
$$ The feature diameter is too large to drill at once..
$$ The depth of the top chamfer is too large.
REM $$ The feature is in a slanted surface in which we cannot centerdrill.
$$ Diameter Tolerance smaller than lower boundary
$$ Diameter Tolerance larger than upper boundary
$$ Side Roughness too fine for DRILL
$$ Side Roughness too course for DRILL
$$ Diameter Tolerance smaller than lower boundary
$$ Diameter Tolerance larger than upper boundary
$$ Side Roughness too fine for DRILL
$$ Side Roughness too course for DRILL
REM for larger holes try to pre-drill at the max diameter that can be drilled at once.
REM to be considered: for larger holes try to pre-drill at the max diameter that can be drilled at once.
REM IF mwf.DIAMETER_1 > constant.Pre_Drill_LimitR/constant.LWF_Predrill_Factor_Upper THEN lwf.DIAMETER_1 = constant.Pre_Drill_Limit
REM be very blunt and always pre-drill at the max diameter that can be drilled at once
$$ Diameter Tolerance smaller than lower boundary
$$ Diameter Tolerance larger than upper boundary
$$ Side roughness value needs a finishing operation.
$$ Side roughness value cannot be reached with END MILL.
$$ Bottom roughness value needs a finishing operation.
$$ Bottom roughness value cannot be reached with END MILL.
IF mwf.DIAMETER_1 > constant.Pre_Drill_Limit + constant.LWF_Allowance_Mill_Finish_Wall THEN lwf.DIAMETER_1 = constant.Pre_Drill_Limit
IF mwf.DIAMETER_1 <= constant.Pre_Drill_Limit + constant.LWF_Allowance_Mill_Finish_Wall THEN lwf.DIAMETER_1 <= mwf.DIAMETER_1 - constant.LWF_Allowance_Mill_Finish_Wall
IF mwf.DIAMETER_1 <= constant.Pre_Drill_Limit + constant.LWF_Allowance_Mill_Finish_Wall THEN lwf.DIAMETER_1 >= mwf.DIAMETER_1 *0.85

sect1.title: Description
sect1.para:
A countersink may also be used to remove the burr left from a drilling or tapping operation, thereby improving the finish of the product and removing any hazardous sharp edges.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Countersink

$$ Operation sequence control: prefer finishing operation after chamfering the hole.
$$ Use another tool for Radius Chamfer
REM operation depth determined by use_model_depth = always in the template.

sect1.title: Description
sect1.para:
This is a dummy rule which creates a chamfer on a feature which has no chamfer. Application is optional and is controlled by the Rule's Priority.
To disable this Rule, change the constant.Always_Chamfer_Features to 0. When disabled, change this Rule's priority to a very low value like -100.

simplelist.member: $$ Automatic chamfer creation is disabled (constant value = 0)...

sect1.title: Description
sect1.para: Bore the smaller diameter of a Counterbored hole (type is STEP2HOLE). This Rule is applied only when the IT class on the smaller diameter is below a chosen value, by default that is 10 (Best_IT_Class_Drilling).

sect1.title: Description
sect1.para: Drill into the blank material to obtain a centerpoint. But the blank surface is slanted. So a spot facing operation should be done before. The class name for a centerpoint is POCKET_ROUND_TAPERED.

simplelist.member: $$ Only for Slanted surface, when drilling is done after spot facing
$$ This is not a drill point but a tapered hole.

sect1.title: Description
sect1.para: This is a rule that can be applied when the major diameter of the thread is D1 and the pre-drill diameter is D2. This case is recognized when (D1 - D2) is about equal to the thread's pitch.

sect1.title: Description
sect1.para: Bore the smaller diameter of a Counterbored hole (type is STEP2HOLE). This Rule is applied only when the IT class on the smaller diameter is below a chosen value, by default that is 10 (Best_IT_Class_Drilling).

sect1.title: Description
sect1.para:
This is a dummy rule which creates a chamfer on a feature which has no chamfer. Application is optional and is controlled by the Rule's Priority.
To disable this Rule, change the constant.Always_Chamfer_Features to 0. When disabled, change this Rule's priority to a very low value like -100.

simplelist.member: $$ Automatic chamfer creation is disabled (constant value = 0)...
REM only add a chamfer to the smaller diameters when the counterbore has flat bottom

sect1.title: Description
sect1.para:
A countersink may also be used to remove the burr left from a drilling or tapping operation, thereby improving the finish of the product and removing any hazardous sharp edges.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Countersink

simplelist.member: $$ Chamfering already applied or feature was not chamfered.
$$ Operation sequence control: prefer finishing operation after chamfering the hole.

sect1.title: Description
sect1.para:
ZLEVEL_PROFILE is a toolpath processor that is NOT currently FEATURE_BASED. That is: the Cut Area geometry is not derived from the feature. Instead the whole part is used.
This strategy can be used with the remark that it still requires customer manipulation to generate a correct toolpath.

sect1.title: Description

sect1.title: Description
sect1.para: Feature.SubType = 3 means the feature is machined in profiling mode. There is no bottom face, only a wall face. We have an issue with the FM_AREA processor which expects a floor face. Use CAVITY_MILL now which is enhanced. CM does need a blank.

simplelist.member: $$ Feature needs machining in alternative direction.
$$ Side Roughness too course for MILL
REM Use a larger tool than 2 times the feature radius only if there will be finishing afterwards.

REM Path Settings - Cutting Parameters - Strategy - Cutting

sect1.title: Description
sect1.para: Mapping Rule for NX6 Hole Feature that is identified in CAM.

simplelist.member: $$ Mapping denied. This feature may map to a STEP1POCKET since it is not thru.
REM just some possibilities of how we can interpret the FIT attribute...
IF mwf.FIT = "CLOSE(H12)" THEN lwf.DIAMETER_1_LOWER = 0 ELSE lwf.DIAMETER_1_LOWER = constant.LWF_DIAM_LO

sect1.title: Description
sect1.para: Mapping Rule for NX6 Hole Feature that is identified in CAM.

simplelist.member: $$ This is a through hole. Cannot be mapped to a pocket.
REM just some possibilities of how we can interpret the FIT attribute...
IF mwf.FIT = "CLOSE(H12)" THEN lwf.DIAMETER_1_LOWER = 0 ELSE lwf.DIAMETER_1_LOWER = constant.LWF_DIAM_LO
IF (mwf.TIP_ANGLE > 0 AND mwf.TIP_ANGLE < 180) THEN lwf.DEPTH = mwf.DEPTH + 0.5*mwf.DIAMETER/TAN(0.5*mwf.TIP_ANGLE) ELSE lwf.DEPTH = mwf.DEPTH

sect1.title: Description
sect1.para: Mapping Rule for NX6 Hole Feature that is identified in CAM.

simplelist.member: $$ Mapping denied. This feature may map to a STEP2POCKET since it is not thru.
lwf.DEPTH_TOP_CHAMFER = mwf.RELIEF_CHAMFER_OFFSET REM only true if angle =45

sect1.title: Description
sect1.para: Mapping Rule for NX6 Hole Feature that is identified in CAM.

simplelist.member: $$ This is a through hole. Cannot be mapped to a pocket.
$$ Mapping denied because no valid TIP_ANGLE.
IF (mwf.TIP_ANGLE > 0 AND mwf.TIP_ANGLE < 180) THEN lwf.DEPTH = mwf.DEPTH + 0.5*mwf.DIAMETER/TAN(0.5*mwf.TIP_ANGLE) ELSE lwf.DEPTH = mwf.DEPTH
lwf.DEPTH_TOP_CHAMFER = mwf.RELIEF_CHAMFER_OFFSET REM only true if angle =45

sect1.title: Description
sect1.para: Mapping Rule for NX6 Hole Feature that is identified in CAM.

simplelist.member: $$ This is a through hole. Cannot be mapped to a pocket.
IF (mwf.TIP_ANGLE > 0 AND mwf.TIP_ANGLE < 180) THEN lwf.DEPTH = mwf.HOLE_DEPTH + 0.5*mwf.HOLE_DIAMETER/TAN(0.5*mwf.TIP_ANGLE) ELSE lwf.DEPTH = mwf.HOLE_DEPTH

sect1.title: Description
sect1.para: Mapping Rule for NX6 Hole Feature that is identified in CAM.

simplelist.member: $$ Mapping denied since this could be a blind feature.
IF (mwf.TIP_ANGLE > 0 AND mwf.TIP_ANGLE < 180) THEN lwf.DEPTH = mwf.HOLE_DEPTH + 0.5*mwf.HOLE_DIAMETER/TAN(0.5*mwf.TIP_ANGLE) ELSE lwf.DEPTH = mwf.HOLE_DEPTH

sect1.title: Description
sect1.para: Mapping Rule for NX6 Hole Feature that is identified in CAM.

sect1.title: Description
sect1.para: Mapping Rule for NX6 Hole Feature that is identified in CAM.

simplelist.member: $$ Mapping denied. This feature may map to a STEP2POCKET since it is not thru.
lwf.ANGLE_TOP_CHAMFER = mwf.ANGLE REM Not sure about this mapping

sect1.title: Description
sect1.para: Mapping Rule for NX6 Hole Feature that is identified in CAM.

simplelist.member: $$ This is a through hole. Cannot be mapped to a pocket.
lwf.ANGLE_TOP_CHAMFER = mwf.ANGLE REM Not sure about this mapping

sect1.title: Description
sect1.para: Mapping Rule for NX6 Hole Feature that is identified in CAM.

simplelist.member: $$ This is a through hole. Cannot be mapped to a pocket.
REM just some possibilities of how we can interpret the FIT attribute...
IF mwf.FIT = "CLOSE(H12)" THEN lwf.DIAMETER_1_LOWER = 0 ELSE lwf.DIAMETER_1_LOWER = constant.LWF_DIAM_LO
IF (mwf.TIP_ANGLE > 0 AND mwf.TIP_ANGLE < 180) THEN lwf.DEPTH = mwf.DEPTH + 0.5*mwf.DIAMETER/TAN(0.5*mwf.TIP_ANGLE) ELSE lwf.DEPTH = mwf.DEPTH

sect1.title: Description
sect1.para: Mapping Rule for NX6 Hole Feature that is identified in CAM.

simplelist.member: $$ Mapping denied. This feature may map to a STEP2POCKET since it is not thru.
REM just some possibilities of how we can interpret the FIT attribute...
IF mwf.FIT = "CLOSE(H12)" THEN lwf.DIAMETER_1_LOWER = 0 ELSE lwf.DIAMETER_1_LOWER = constant.LWF_DIAM_LO
$$ rejected because feature has no flat floor.
$$ Diameter Tolerance smaller than lower boundary
$$ Diameter Tolerance larger than upper boundary
$$ Side roughness value needs a finishing operation.
$$ Side roughness value cannot be reached with END MILL.
$$ Bottom roughness value needs a finishing operation.
$$ Bottom roughness value cannot be reached with END MILL.

row.entry: Diameters until this value are chamfered by the previous spot drilling operation.
When Depth/Diameter smaller than this value, gun drilling is rejected.
The blank stock for a boring operation.
The blank stock at the bottom for a milling operation.
The blank stock at the side for a milling operation.
The blank stock for a reaming operation.
Lower limit depth deviation of the in process workpiece.
Upper limit depth deviation of the in process workpiece.
Lower limit diameter deviation of the in process workpiece.
Upper limit diameter deviation of the in process workpiece.
Multiply the final diameter with this value to obtain the lower boundary of the pre-drilled hole.
Multiply the final diameter with this value to obtain the upper boundary of the pre-drilled hole.
Point Angle will generally be dependent of the workpiece material.
Holes with a diameter up to this value can be drilled at once. Larger holes need be pre-drilled.
The lower boundary of the reachable IT quality class when using a BORING BAR
The upper boundary of the reachable IT quality class when using a BORING BAR
The lower boundary of the reachable IT quality class when using a DRILL

The upper boundary of the reachable IT quality class when using a DRILL. A value 14 is more realistic but that would result in many features not machined since the default upper and lower boundaries are 0.5 mm and that results in IT16.
The lower boundary of the reachable IT quality class when using a MILL
The upper boundary of the reachable IT quality class when using a MILL.
The lower boundary of the reachable IT quality class when using a REAMER
The upper boundary of the reachable IT quality class when using a REAMER
The lower boundary of the reachable roughness when using a BORING BAR (micrometer and microinch)
The upper boundary of the reachable roughness when using a BORING BAR (micrometer and microinch)
The lower boundary of the reachable roughness when using a DRILL (micrometer and microinch)
The upper boundary of the reachable roughness when using a DRILL (micrometer and microinch)
The upper boundary of the reachable roughness when using a DRILL (micrometer and microinch)
The lower boundary of the reachable roughness when using a END MILL (micrometer and microinch)
The lower boundary of the reachable roughness when using a END MILL (micrometer and microinch)
The upper boundary of the reachable roughness when using a MILL (micrometer and microinch)
The upper boundary of the reachable roughness when using a MILL (micrometer and microinch)
Treshold value for Finishing when using an END MILL (micrometer and microinch)
Treshold value for Finishing when using an END MILL (micrometer and microinch)
The lower boundary of the reachable roughness when using a REAMER (micrometer and microinch)
The upper boundary of the reachable roughness when using a REAMER (micrometer and microinch)
Holes in a slanted surface with angle larger than this value require a spot facing operation first.
Used to test on zero values.
Determines how deep the toolpath goes thru the hole.
When value =1 then features will be chamfered also if no chamfer in the CAD model.
When value = 1, the point angle of the drill must match the tip angle of the feature.
When value = 1 then a spot drilling operation is generated before drilling.
The chamfer angle for constructed chamfers.
The chamfer depth of constructed chamfers.
Add retract Distance on Tool Axis Change
